Uber and Lyft can be used to get around campus. \nThe Penn State Cata Buses are also a free option, and the Blue Loop (BL) and White Loop (WL) can be used to get around campus and downtown. Only the Blue Loop, White Loop, Red Link, and Green Link are free. All other buses require payment in exact change.
Venmo us @William-Juppenlatz or pay with cash! \nPlease include "PUNC Merch", your name, and your committee name in the message if you use Venmo.

United Nations Campus Advocates is a campus chapter of a nation wide movement to rally support for the work of the United Nations. At Penn State, we advocate to our peers about all the good that the UN accomplishes. This year we are supporting a campaign by the UN Foundation called Shot@Life. Funds raised through Shot@Life aid Unicef, the World Health Organization and Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, in the coordination, purchase, delivery and administering of vaccines to children in developing countries. To get an idea of the impact of donations on this effort, just $25 provides a vaccine for one child against polio, measles, diarrheal disease, and pneumonia for life. \nLean more at ShotatLife.org.
You can donate to Shot@Life campaign with cash or Venmo @William-Juppenlatz with the message "Shot@Life Donation". We thank you for your support!
